Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but the area...?”
Reviews.Author: strawblonde48
Reviews.Content: this hotel is nice, but it's in a bit of a "seedy" area. I didn't like being accosted by 3 homeless drunks while trying to go into the front entrance, persistantly! There isn't anything right nearby like in the better tourity parts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Contemporary Look - Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: Kizmet9
Reviews.Content: I recently held a meeting at the Hilton Garden Inn Toronto / City Centre - I had not been to the property in years and was so impressed by the recent renovations - nicer than some of the 'luxury' properties in the city - but what really blew me away was the service. From start to finish the service was exemplary - from my initial contact with Karen McQuade - the Director of Sales and Marketing to Inga and Matt in Conference Services - to the Executive Chef (sorry I forgot his name) to Nathan the Food and Beverage Manager to Endri the Chief Engineer and Elias the doorman - the entire team was outstanding and the hospitality was professional, personal and genuine. I have interacted with numerous hotels in my time but this was truly an outstanding experience and I cannot speak highly enough. The other hotels in the city should sit up and take note because the team at the Hilton Garden Inn / Toronto City Centre could give lessons in hospitality. This hotel is a hidden gem in the city of Toronto - wish I'd realized it sooner!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient and good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: mhuang
Reviews.Content: We bought a Living Social coupon for Hilton Garden Inn - King Deluxe Room. It came with $20 of valet parking (they only have valet parking), full breakfast for two, and either late checkout or early check-in. The hotel is near Dundas Station. Cleanliness - was pretty good, although there was a ritz cracker on our floor. The bed was comfortable - can be adjusted softness/firmness. It was quiet (although you can hear people if they are talking loud in the hallway). The breakfast was good - one of the best hotel breakfast we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Just OK Neigborhood”
Reviews.Author: Chicago Flyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights for work. Close to Eaton Center - just a few blocks away. Lots of homeless/addict types around but never bothered by them. Right on a street car line. Lobby modern. Good breakfast. My room was large with a large bathroom that even had a big window - let in lots of natural light. Has a tub - would prefer a walk in shower (no need to step in and out of the tub). Relatively quiet room - needed to unplug the small fridge (it was cycling on and off all night). Bed was very comfortable, lots of pillows - some soft, some hard so you could choose what you wanted. Would stay here again. FYI - didn't park, took a car from Pearson airport - expensive - 55CAD fixed fee from airport to downtown. (didn't impact my rating of this hotel - just FYI)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, dicey location”
Reviews.Author: acculligan
Reviews.Content: This is a good new hotel, and provides good amenities, well priced and modern decor. Problem being, it's in a very dodgy location. I would not walk outside at night on my own and even during the day I was clutching my wallet. I only found out during my stay. however, if you had your own car and were parking underground then this would be a great option. I had to cab/walk everywhere and felt very uncomfortable. The staff are great though and the rooms were well appointed. The gym was simple and effective and the breakie was good and well priced. the only other problem is the restaurant attached to the hotel (Casey's) had TERRIBLE food . This is also the room service provider and considering i didn't want to leave the hotel and had to eat room service, I wasn't too impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Toronto, we would book there again”
Reviews.Author: SunnyToronto_On
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised to book at this nice hotel for under $200 a night. As always, the Hilton beds do not disappoint. The King Size bed was very comfortable. Water pressure in the shower was good, and everything was clean and neat. The breakfast buffet was a nice selection of fruit,yogout, muffins, hot oatmeal, juice and coffee for $10; if you wanted a hot breakfast, you paid $4 more, and they would make you eggs, bacon/sausage - the works. The staff was very friendly, helpful and thoughtful. We travel around the world, and this is the only place where the cleaning staff wrote a thank you note for their tips (3 nights, 2 different housekeeping ladies!) You will not be disappointed at this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Location iffy”
Reviews.Author: VisitedNewPlaces
Reviews.Content: Of course, I drove from Toronto Pearson to the wrong HGI by GPS, which was Downtown. They directed me to the correct property, City Centre, located on Dundas street. Check in was rapid and in no time I was in my room. The room was maintained well, and had a nice color scheme that was relaxing. The bed was comfortable, and had the adjustable air cell mattress with a dial for softness adjustment. The room was standard size for a hotel. The bathroom had a tub shower, with a curving shower curtain rod to simulate extra space. The water pressure was strong, and temperature consistent. The room AC was great and did NOT blow on the bed, which is always nice when trying to sleep comfortably. The gym was very nice and had well maintained equipment. My only issue with this property was it's location. Endless amounts of homeless frequented the area. I would walk maybe 8 city blocks to Eaton Centre for Starbucks or to find restaurants, which was fine, and along the way pass a homeless wanderer on every block. Most left you alone, but a few would beg for money or food. Sometimes they would laugh incessantly at nothing. Avoiding them was not an an issue. It began to bother me more when at the hotel they would stalk the front door area, coming up for handouts and one day, trying to sell fake watches when I departed in my car. I found out from the attached restaurant , Casey's, that the Homeless Shelter was a few blocks away. The bottom line is I found the property appealing and would stay there again, but am now aware of the clientele I expect to encounter on a daily basis when walking outside.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Tusker1950
Reviews.Content: In the heart of downtown Toronto. Check-in was fast. the room was a good size one bedroom, with a whirlpool tub. There was plenty of room for two people. The shower in the bathroom was quite small, but we did take advantage of the whirlpool. Breakfast on the second floor was very good with buffet items plus waffles and cooked to order omlettes. Overall it was a comfortable evening.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: lbmontreal
Reviews.Content: In middle if downtown Toronto, close to everything. Rooms are great and lately renovated. When we asked for rolling bed for the kid and they didn't have it in regular room, they upgraded for penthouse for free! Great service but smile more, visitors like it. Great breakfast. If I go again to Toronto, will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel, great for business people”
Reviews.Author: noarc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel thru the week for close to 2 months. I can not say enough about the service, the clean hotel, and the rooms are a good size as well. They have a wonderful breakfast on the 2nd floor which has everything imaginable. The staff work hard to please you and the friendlyness of the front line upon arrival is bar none. Sean is a real pleasure to deal with. If you have to stay in Toronto for business they have all you need including a workout area, business area as well. I highly recommend this hotel. The cost is reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for NXNE!”
Reviews.Author: kerrihop
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a quick overnight in Toronto. The location was great and we were pleasantly surprised to learn that the NXNE music festival was happening just a few blocks away in Dundas Square. We may try to stay there again next year. The bar downstairs was cozy and a great place to end the night. The valet parking was convenient and work the $20. The only negative for me was that the unexpected down comforters (which I hadn't seen listed in the room info on the website) really did a number on my allergies. I didn't complain to the front desk, so I don't want that to count against them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: S A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights of Christmas Weekend. We had a pleasant experience right from checkin through checkout. The staffs were very courteous. We had breakfast included in our stay. The food was great. You may end up waiting for couple of minutes for getting your car from valet parking during rush hours. So plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty beds and bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: lisa m
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to the Dundas/Jarvis Toronto location, the hotel seemed nice. We had a double bed reserved. The room was filthy. The bed linens were dirty and had hairs strewn in between the sheets (even though someone had made the beds,they obviously wanted the room to appear clean). The bathroom had not been cleaned either. The toilet (upon arrival) had soiled toilet paper in it, the toilet seat had feces and hairs on it and the toilet bowl was splashed with feces. Our next room smelled of body odor, we ignored this and went to bed (after an intense search of the room of course). We went to Toronto for Cancer treatment at Toronto Western Hospital. When I booked the reservation I asked if there was a discount for hospital stays, she answered "no". Upon check-out this topic was mentioned again, the acting manager claimed we could have gotten a discount (We paid $60 more/night! Of course he could not refund the difference, that would be the nice thing to do). The manager said he would only charge us half for parking considering the awful experience we had with the Hilton...but guess what... my credit card has the parking charge on it! Unbelievable! On another note, this is strictly my personal preference, I was not a big fan of the beds and pillows but this is subjective. If you stay at the Hilton, I hope you have a better stay the we did. Sorry Paris, you won't be getting any of my money ever again

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jean-marc2011
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hilton after looking up several places in Toronto. I wanted to be able to walk to Toronto University without taking cabs all the time. The hotel is located near King Street where you will find plenty of great restaurants and nighttime activities. The neighborhood is really pleasant to discover on foot. The room was spotless (Hilton type) and felt brand new. A very extensive breakfast was included in my rate. I recommend it as you will start your day on a high note in a pleasant atmosphere. Only drawbacks. One is the internet which was a huge disappointment ( maybe a temporary problem). it kept crashing and the wire connection refused to work. The second is the lack of a proper lobby. In my case , I do not care so it does not bother me. Conclusion: great place for a short trip to Toronto, about $100 cheaper than the "real Hilton" for about the same inroom value. Will go back for sure. Will inquire about the internet first though.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: windsorwand31
Reviews.Content: We used our CAA membership which gave a room rate better than the more common hotel booking sites and booked through the Hilton Site. Planned to stay 4 nights but left on Sat to overnight with friends outside of the City. We returned on Sunday . On both "check-ins " we were able to do an "early check-in" . The hotel is new, clean, well appointed. Staff friendly, helpful from front desk to housekeeping. Rooms well appointed, COMPLIMENTARY INTERNET which appears to be atypical in Downtown Toronto Hotels. Location excellent for walking to popular tourist, theater, shopping districts. (We are Urban Hikers) . We did not have a car and parking is 30.00/day which might be off putting to some.. Our Toronto stay from Thurs to Mon. and the purpose to visit our son employed in the Financial District and to sight see.We were very pleased with our choice of Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My new favourite hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: w0rshipthesun
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel to the Toronto area and the Hilton Garden Inn City Centre has become my new favorite. I have stayed in larger hotels however this hotel gives you the intimate atmosphere of a boutique hotel. The staff are all very friendly and welcoming. Beds were very comfortable love the feature of being able to adjust the firmness. Fitness center features great equipment rivaling a high end gym to help keep my exercise regime in. Breakfast in the morning was great very plentiful featuring many healthy options. I will be returning to the Hilton Garden Inn on my next trip to Toronto for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Who doesn't know that hotels don't allow smokers”
Reviews.Author: Trumpeterhere
Reviews.Content: My first night I could not find the source of the cigarette smoke. I told the front desk that the room next door was smoking. They tried to call but no answer. They went in the hall and no smell. They cam to my room and smelled the smoke coming from the vent that is shared by my room and the smoker's room. I finally knocked on the door and asked if he was smoking...."yes", he said. I told him that this is a non smoking hotel..."I did not know that..I will not smoke again." 30 minutes later...smoke again. Then 30 minutes later again. I call security and they asked him....he said that he only smoked once and when I told him to stop, he did stop. THAT GUY LIED. I could smell the smoke, security could smell the smoke and he lied. They changed my room to another room. When I entered my new room, the room stunk of old cigarette smoke. You know the type when someone smokes in a room all day and then leaves. How could the house keeping let this room pass???!!! I then changed to a third room. This one is okay but not the best. The front lobby of the hotel stinks of cig. smoke. Smokers outside the front door and the wind blows in the smoke. These too are the hotel employees. They smoke out back or on the side. THE SMOKE TRAVEL THROUGH THE HOTEL. YES, it STINKS. The lobby...blahh. HGI...your smoking employees and guests are ruining your hotel. I cannnot take a chance to hold another meeting here. Te odds of a smoky room or lobby are high. The hotel was helpful at moving me around but they don' deal with the problem...SMOKING in the ROOM. My 3rd room has that stale smeel. I can't come back. Too many Hiltons in the area that would be better. I stay 100 nights a year in hotels, mostly Hilton and Hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Price+ Location+ Quality= Unmatched”
Reviews.Author: Maxxinaround
Reviews.Content: If your looking to stay in Toronto there is no better place to go for the following reasons. Price + location + quality: Although it's not your cheapest if you search the entire web you'll find there is two price brackets the cheap and the expensive. Problem with the cheap bracket is your guaranteed a horrible or a stay completely out of the city time unless your a steps away from sleeping in the streets or your looking to backpack through the country i don't recommend. The expensive price bracket goes to such a ridiculous price you wonder if they'll massage you to sleep. The Hilton garden inn city center is at the bottom price of that price bracket it stays affordable while giving you the Hilton seal of quality of accommodations and perks..now this is where is gets good. So you have a quality hotel with a great price...but are you 12min walk away from the center of the city...i doubt that. At a location like this you should be paying an arm and a leg and the person at the door couldn't be friendlier ask for Jackie and you'll feel like your checking in a sweet local BnB hotel. ENjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: Ravs27
Reviews.Content: Had the chance to stay here while in Toronto for an appointment and the service and cleanliness of this hotel were spot on. Will definitely book here again when in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: deltabeachers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we had a one-week business trip, and they offer suites with a separate bedroom. It fit the bill: centrally located, clean enough, a quiet sleep, great working desk with ergonomic Herman Miller chair, mini bar incl. microwave, and optional breakfast with a decent choice of wholesome food. By necessity, the only parking is by valet at additional charge - not very convenient but we never had to wait, and taxis were plentiful for short trips to the endless array of restaurants nearby. Notably, service was EXCELLENT, especially front desk staff, but also right down the line. Very friendly, helpful, and professional people. In the room, we would have liked more seating for relaxing (the only seating was a loveseat and the office chair). One downside to this hotel was the number of homeless people outside & on the surrounding streets at all hours. There appears to be at least one shelter on the same block. I felt safe enough walking alone by day, but would not have ventured out on foot after dark. This was not a huge deterrent though, and we would most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Portishead trip-hop”
Reviews.Author: laboheme78
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night to go to Sound Academy to see Portishead. Nice location.Within walking distance of the downtown area. I'd stay there again..other hotels are way too pricey. You can stay here...nice rooms, service and nice staff at the bar downstairs :)

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: lollipop3397
Reviews.Content: lovely staff, the concierge Gretchen is very helpful. Room was spacious and clean. Centrally located, near to bike station (one of the nice things in Toronto, you can easily rent a bike for 24 or 72 hours to get through the city). Breakfast was very good, nice and helpfull staff. Would certainly recommend anybody to stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “One Bad Apple...”
Reviews.Author: newslettereditor
Reviews.Content: ...can spoil a barrel goes the old saying that can be applied to the service industry as well. On a recent stay at a favourite Hilton Garden Inn I encountered the bad apple. Needing water for some medications after returning late to the Inn, I found no water had been left as is the usual practice. I phoned the front desk, as I was already in PJs, and was told' "you only get two bottles per stay." I pointed out that up to this point we had been receiving two bottles per day. I was curtly told that was a mistake. The next morning there was no daily newspaper, another common practice at this excellent Inn. Next morning, I stopped at the front to have clarification and was told that we indeed do get two bottles of water per day, and the daily newspaper, and for the rest of our stay, that was the case. I could very well have written off this hotel, as there are a lot of others in the immediate area, but the kind way the staff resolved the problem in the morning made me realise that I had encountered "the Bad apple" and I was not going to tar the entire staff with the same brush. When you are a guest there, stop and talk to the concierge, Gretchen, who will put a smile on your face with her infectious nature and perhaps give you suggestions and directions to Toronto's attractions. Unfortunately, I had a tired mattress which I forgot to point out before leaving, but hopefully a staff member will read this and check out the quality of the mattress in room 317.

Reviews.Title: “front desk staff's attitudes need to improve”
Reviews.Author: Allanwwt
Reviews.Content: First impression is very critial to success. When my wife & I felt quite upset during the process of check-in because the front desk staff tossed the revservation confirmation copy on the desk. Then, when I called the front desk for check-out (to be honest, I like this quick way for check-out), the staff expressed "aw" after I told her I was going to check out now. Maybe she did not expect of my check-out at that time, 11:10 a.m. (policy is 12 p.m.). Anyway, other than that issue, this hotel has very good values in price, location, room cleanliness, and bed comfort. I will definitely stay in this hotel for my next visit in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: sakinkedi
Reviews.Content: everything was absolutely perfect! one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “No real complaints but no real plaudits, either”
Reviews.Author: Blizzardave
Reviews.Content: The hotel is alright. I would like to find a complaint about it but I can't really. The thing that's causing my discomfort, I suppose, is that the hotel is nothing special. It's within easy walking distance of downtown but that's about it. The lobby is cool but the room I stayed in was average. The service is average. Getting in and out is a bit of a challenge since the entryway is always jammed up with taxis and limousines. On the other hand, the parking is fine but a bit inconvenient because you have to shuttle the car around to onload and offload your luggage. The price is fair, I suppose. When I stayed there it was during a real heat wave and I had to keep the air conditioning on all the time which was a bit of an annoyance because the air conditioning unit was fairly noisy. I know it sounds like I'm listing some pretty piddly complaints and I am, I suppose. It's just that, you know that feeling you get when you leave a place and you think to yourself that it 'wasn't all that'? That's the feeling I had when I left. Perhaps the clearest rating I can give is to say that, although I've been back to Toronto at least 15 times since I stayed at this hotel, I've never stayed there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: butterfli_8
Reviews.Content: Helpful & Friendly staff. Our room was kept very clean and we could not hear a peep from other rooms. The refrigerator did make a lot of noise but that's a very minor detail. The breakfasts were great and the staff working in the restaurant area were very quick, helpful, and accommodating. The hotel is very close to the Eaton Center, however I would not suggest walking around alone at night. There were a lot of homeless people strung out on the side of the hotel, and when waiting out front, I was often asked for money. Contrary to what the staff at the front desk told us, the parking lot behind the building is only $14 per night. While it is unsupervised at night, we did not have any bad experiences. We did opt for the valet at the Hilton before deciding to take a chance on the other place. The valet (no option to park yourself) at the Hilton is $30 a night and we often had to wait for the valet attendant. It happened on a couple of occasions that we had to wait a long period of time for him to return and the staff at the front desk could not locate them. At a steep price for parking and having to wait for the car to be returned, they were definitely expecting a tip when they brought back the car. Just a little awkward. All in all the beds are comfortable, the rooms are clean, and I would not hesitate to recommend this as a place to stay when visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in the City!”
Reviews.Author: sean p
Reviews.Content: Staff were fantastic and always smiling. Very central location which worked out perfect as we were able to walk anywhere in the city in no more then 20 minutes. Streetcar straight to chinatown. subway station 6 minute walk from Hotel. The Hotel staff is what really makes this Hotel a Gem! Be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Definitley my place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Ann J
Reviews.Content: I just finished a 2 week stay at the Hilton Garden Inn in Dundas and Jarvis. I could not have asked for anything better!. Right from the beginning the smiles and friendliness of the staff made me feel welcome to both,the hotel and the City, which I was visiting for the first time. The hotel is very well located in the down town area and close to the subway, the Concierge was extremely helpful in providing me with directions and recommendations of local restaurants and attractions. to The breakfast was wonderful and the Business Centre had all I needed to keep in touch with my office. The rooms are very clean and nicely decorated. Most of all, the staff was amazing, always helpful and making sure that I was well taken care of. There was not a day that passed by without receiving a warm greeting and a smile from the staff. It is that personal touch and care that made my stay just perfect. I will be visiting Toronto often during this year and the Hilton Garden Inn Toronto City Centre will definitely be my place to stay!.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: C K
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler both on business and pleasure, I do not often provide a write up for a hotel. However, given my most recent stay at the Hilton Garden Inn City Centre and the exceptional service I felt compelled to share my experience. I recently stayed at this hotel whilst I was on business in Toronto. I was amazed at the incredible customer service from all members of staff from the front desk personnel, the cleaning staff up to the General Manager. They all went out of their way to ensure that everything was in place for my stay to be as comfortable as possible. The hotel has recently been renovated and is a beautiful place located right in the centre of the city. I was able to walk to all of the major sites. The rooms are immaculate. It had everything one required to make the stay just right. On top of this, their gym and pool facilities are also immaculate. The gym is bright and cheerful and has new equipment. I have stayed at many 5 star properties that do not come close to the service or facilities which this hotel provides. I highly recommend this to anyone travelling on business or with a family.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hilton in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AnnaFrancis
Reviews.Content: Where do I start. LoL First of all as soon as I arrived there was no concierge to bring in my luggage. When i asked for one they told me they did not have one an di was to do this myself. From there the lady at the front desk was rude and let me know that all of a sudden the room deposit was all of a sudden double what it was supposed to be "due to the caribana season" were her exact words. Which meant i had to withdrawl more money than i had intended which led me to have to call my husband and make arrangement immediatly to find a western union stand in line cab there and back just to pay the extras. That cost me money and timeout of my day meaning i could not enjoy most of the plans i had made for that day because this took me an hour and a half to figure out! I was not aloud in my room until i gave her the extra money. When i arrived back with it then she changed her mind again and said she made a mistake and it was actually once again more than i had so i had to make a second trip due to her neglect to give me the proper info prior! I was super tired and annoyed. The hotel did not have room service which led me to wander toronto in search of clean substinance and as soon as i left the hotel there were junkies everywhere and i was deathly afraid to get robbed. In the lobby there was an officer who was taking information from the staff due to the fact that one of the maids children had been STABBED down the block at school!!! how horrible and this gives a small description of the location! A strip club which was inhabited by the lowest lifeforms outside was right beside the hotel!!! Everytime i left the hotel i was asked for money, drugs and cigarettes by bums right in the front and there was absolutly no security at the front door for my whole stay! I could have been hurt. There was a spider in my room and i did not open the windows once, which made me wonder to the cleanliness. When i climbed up to kill it i fell and fractured my back in my room which was a pain undescribable! The hotel knew of this and sent me a chocolate bar? lol and a card saying sorry which i still have. The workout room equipment was broken and led me to have another injury smashing my kneecap on the bike because the seat was loose and wobbly and when i told the hotel they sent a mechanical guy who thought to blame me which was utterly ridiculous being i am 115 lbs and was only on the bike for 2-3 min! The hot tub had grime inbetween the tiling which was unacceptable! when i left the hotel due to my injuries to recieve proper care elsewhere i was surprised to see the cart for my luggage at my door once again with no help or sight of a concierge! In my opinion this hotel should be stripped of the hilton name all together! I am now still in recovery of my injuries from this so called vacation. If you want the truth about this hotel stay there for a night and tell me if your happy in the morning. Totally unacceptable I paid 600.00 extra to aircanada to re-book my flight and get out of there fast. I was going to stay another 2 weeks but if i did im sure soemthing worse would have happened to me on the premisis. My injuried were os bad i had to be carted to my flight and wheelchaired on my plane which was embarrasing and painful for me.

Reviews.Title: “'Can't wait to go back"”
Reviews.Author: cruiselady77
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. The front desk was very helpful getting cabs etc. Rooms were average sized but very well appointed. Food in the on site restaraunt was very good. We found the pool and hot tub area clean and relaxing. The concierge was very informational and took care of arranging our tour. The hotel is close enough to walk to Eaton Centre and there were many small businesses and eateries along the way even though it's on the edge of town. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential ......”
Reviews.Author: tarheelblue89
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Garden Inn Toronto City Centre has a lot of positives: the location is an easy walk to Dundas Square; the room appeared clean and spacious (see below); there is a small market in the lobby for bottled water, snacks and miscellaneous items; a Casey's Bar and Grill is located on-site; and a reasonably priced and filling breakfast buffet is available on the second floor. Unfortunately, I would hesitate to recommend the hotel based on our botched reservation and resulting housekeeping issue. Upon check-in, we were informed by the counter agent that they had overbooked the rooms with two queen beds and thus had "upgraded" us to a suite with a King and sleeper sofa. Given that there were three in our party, we had no alternative but accept. This was unfortunate because: (1) the sheets had not been changed on the sleeper sofa. After calling the desk, fresh sheets were quickly brought to the door. But because housekeeping had gone for the day, we changed the sheets ourselves; (2) when unfolded, there was no space between the sofa and the television cabinet; and (3) this fold-out's comfort didn't qualify as the advertised "sweet dreams bed experience." Placing a party of three in room a requiring use of the fold-out (due to a hotel error) is bad enough, but not then ensuring that the linens on the fold-out were fresh is just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best overall hotel experiences”
Reviews.Author: NYPeggyd
Reviews.Content: Some reviews of this location warn about the "sketchy" neighborhood but these warnings are ill-founded. The hotel is located just a short walk to Yonge St., Chinatown, fantastic restaurants and the theater. The neighborhood is multi-ethnic and very safe and comfortable. The guest rooms are spacious, nicely appointed, and luxuriously comfortable. The beds are adjustable for softness or firmness and the linens fresh and crisp. There are refrigerators, microwaves, and coffee/tea makers in the room. The bathrooms have fluffy towels, a large adjustable showerhead and all the necessary toiletries. The front desk staff were genuinely friendly, helpful, and courteous. The crowning jewel of this particular hotel is the Chief Concierge Gretchen Meiring. Her directions, advice, and opinions were spot-on. She was truly committed to the success of our visit. We're already planning on staying there during our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: maguirecn
Reviews.Content: Great value hotel just 10 minutes walk from all the downtown attractions. Don't be put off by the 'down at heel' appearance of the Dundas East area this is an excellent hotel. The staff are attentive and the service is good. The hotel is a little dated and the rooms slightly dark but very comfortable and well equipped for business travellers

Reviews.Title: “Walk to Eaton Center”
Reviews.Author: pcameron
Reviews.Content: Best location if you are going to shop at Eaton Center, it is just a few blocks. The are right around the hotel looks a bit seedy at first glance but we have stayed here 3 times and always walk around the area and have never had any problems. The restaurant connected to the hotel has excellent food and a friendly little bar and you can charge your drinks and food to your room. There are many restaurants within walking distance including pubs and a large movie theatre, not to mention the huge Eaton Center Mall. We always stay at this hotel when we are in Toronto. The staff is friendly, hotel is clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: spencsj
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here twice on a visit to Canada! The hotel was easy to get to with the Airport Express which stops 2 blocks from and in sight of the hotel at Bond Place Hotel. Public transport in Toronto was easy to access from the hotel. The first morning we walked in under 10 minutes to Eaton for the Dundas Metro stop. The number 505 tram (street car) stops on Jarvis/Dundas outside the hotel and goes to Eaton and you can buy day use scratchcards for the trams, buses and metro. The 505 also took us to one of the Chinatown areas for some food. The check in was friendly and efficient and we were given breakfast vouchers, we were pleasantly surprised with our room as it had a bathtub with a spa system for bubbles. Being English we brought our own Tea and the coffee maker was fine with our teabags. We asked the maid in the corridor for some extra sugar and she immediately brought us plenty for our stay. Thanks Irma! The room on 6 was quiet, the bed was very comfy and we both slept well. The breakfast was great with newspapers, juices, fruit, yoghurt, cereals, breads, pastries, cook yourself waffles and cooked to order breakfast.so we were well set-up for the day. The staff in here were really efficient and friendly. In the evenings we didn't eat but did have a nice cold beer in the Caseys on the ground floor. Our conclusion was the local Steam Whistle beer was the nicest! A few reviewers referred to the area. A couple of times we were approached by people on the streets asking for money/food/cigarettes but when told no they went away and I didn't feel unsafe. There is some development starting in this area so I am sure it is on the 'up'. We'd happily use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with the Cleanliness of the Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Palmsway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location this past weekend, and have to say how impressed I was with the room decor and the cleanliness. I too work for a Hilton property and I must say the rooms surpassed my expectation for a downtown Toronto hotel. The rooms are great!! The decor is fresh and current, the beds were extremely comfortable, and most importantly... it was so very clean!! The hotel itself is walking distance of the Eaton's center and Dundas Square(bonus). Thanks for a memorable weekend H.G.I. Downtown Toronto!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, acceptable location”
Reviews.Author: MikelWard
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've stayed at in a while. Nice spacious rooms, reasonable rates. Not exactly in the middle of Toronto, but only a short walk to downtown, and a number of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel with a Great Service”
Reviews.Author: vk1976
Reviews.Content: My husband and me stayed at Hilton Garden Inn City Center for 4 nights in July 2011. We booked the room via Kayak.com for approx 150$ per night including taxes (without breakfast). We had a very nice stay. The room at the 6 floor was spacious, clean and quiet, though a window size was rather small. The ergonomic mattress was really comfortable, and the quality of sleep was great. Especially, we enjoyed the complimentary high-speed internet service that was already included into the above mentioned price and worked impeccably. Other than the room, we did not take advantage of other hotel amenities. There is a small indoor swimming pool and a fitness room. For 13 CAD$, you can have a breakfast at the hotel but we did not try it. The service was very considerate. For instance, I did not feel well when we were supposed to check out from the hotel, and we were allowed to stay in the room the extra-hour, which was very helpful. In terms of location, the hotel is located within 10 minutes walk from the Toronto Eaton Center and 15 minutes walk from the Lawrence Market. However, at night time, there is somewhat unpleasant to walk in a close proximity of the hotel. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would consider going back there when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “3 Great Nights in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MisssFit
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, conveniently located close to the Eaton Centre with some really good restaurants within walking distance. Rooms are a little tired but overall clean and the staff are outstanding, friendly and very helpful. This is not my first stay here and definitely won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we stay in Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: LUV2travel-notmuch$
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this particular property for about 10 years -- every time we go to Toronto. We enjoyed it as a Choice property, but like it even better since Hilton took ownership. The location is great for Downtown Toronto attractions. A short walk to the Canon Theatre, the Eaton Centre and the subway. We like the range of room options, which allow us to bump up to a suite if our son is with us, or pick a studio if we're travelling on our own. Having a Casey's on site provides handy dinner and room services options for families. The staff are excellent. They provide great customer service and are extremely responsive to any concerns that have arisen during past trips (e.g. noisy, partying neighbours.) The pool area is nice and well maintained, though small. The breakfast restaurant offers great selections, though it's a bit pricey for a family if you're not a member of the Hilton Honors program at a level that includes free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at Affordable Rates”
Reviews.Author: scottanderson1978
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Hilton when we went to the UFC in April. The hotel's location was on the fringe of downtown and in a slightly sketchy neighbourhood, but only a 2-block walk away from Yonge Street, the Eaton Centre and downtown, which was not a big deal at all. The hotel was clean, the staff were very friendly and helpful and the room rates were excellent value for money. The breakfast buffet was well worth the money as well, I highly recommend it. All in all, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Above average HGI”
Reviews.Author: jmcp
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, friendly staff and Casey's provides good food for room service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, sketchy neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: jeffclay
Reviews.Content: The hotel was spotless and the staff are top-notch. The housekeeping crew were tremendous and our stay in the hotel was flawless. However, I traveled with my teen daughter for an end of school getaway and never felt safe strolling around the few blocks surrounding the hotel. At all hours of the day, but especially after dark the place is crawling with addicts and beggars. Virtually every time we left the hotel we were accosted by tragic looking folks panhandling and talking to themselves. Since our stay I have discovered that the area around the hotel is referred to as "transitional." There is a decrepit strip joint next door- the transition has a long way to go. I loved the hotel but would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller12328
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very conveniently located but what really made the stay outstanding was the great and friendly service I received from all the employees since the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out!. They the rooms are nice and renovated, the breakfast was fantastic. I will definetly make it my place to stay when visiting Toronto!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingBill33
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the HGI this past wknd and wanted to specifically comment on the exceptional service we received from the breakfast staff (specifically Japan). I have never received such good service in my entire life from Japan, his service was exceptional. The hotel location is no where near as bad as other members have stated, it is a 5 minute walk to Dundas and Yonge and yes it isn't in the most trendy neighbourhood but it is safe and fine. Several people have commented on the homeless people in the area in a negative manner which i find ignorant, these people need our help not our condemnation. Instead of ignoring them, help them out. Also there is a Smoke's poutinery across the street which is delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay at this hotel again, even if I was paid too!”
Reviews.Author: charlieAE
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 1 night in April 2011. Myself and four friends cam into Toronto from out of town to catch a Rock game and go out downtown. Before leaving to go out for the night I took my ID and money out of my wallet and left my wallet in our room... ensuring that I would not lose it out that night. I guess I should have taken it with me.... because it was stollen out of our room after we left! I told the manager "Jackie" before leaving the hotel in the morning that my wallet had been taken and she said she would check on it. when I got home... I called my credit card company to cancel my cards to find out that someone had used my credit card at 3am. I called Jackie back at the hotel... in this time of distress, she was not sympathetic at all, but started yelling at me saying there was no way that any worker in her hotel stole my wallet... she then put me on hold for 15 min and never came back to the phone. I called the hotel back, she answered right away(obviously not busy enough to keep me on hold) and then acted like she did not know who i was. They gave us the total run around until we said we were filing a police report and then they said they would check the security report of the key cards to show when our hotel room door was openned. Another manager called back and said the door was openned at 6:55pm and 2:30am. We did in fact return to the room at 2:30am... but had left for the game before 6pm. When I told her that, she put me on hold and came back to the phone and said she had made a mistake... the report actually said 5:52pm!!!!!!!!!!!!!! What a convienent mistake! Obviously they did not want to make their hotel look bad and admit to anything but I know exactly where the wallet was left... someone working in that hotel is a thief and I will NEVER stay there again! They actually said " we are sorry about your wallet.... so the next time u stay here we will upgrade you to a suite for no extra charge"!! haaha If you do choose to stay there... make sure to take a lock with u!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff make it worth staying here”
Reviews.Author: jetsetters23
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from this Hotel, that we used as a base for see Toronto. We used most facilities and amenities. The pool and hot tub were impeccably clean - as was the gym. Rooms were above average or cleanliness, space and comfort. We are a family of 4-5 depending on our niece. The staff at this Hotel we as good as or better than any 5 star we have stayed at. Always a good morning with a smile, all the way to a helpful holding of a door. Hilton should have all managers in the system train here.Absolutely exceptional customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great city centre hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lewes77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a welcome surprise. I have stayed in more expensive hotels in Toronto and this Hotel is definitely much better at $100 per night. The rooms are excellent, large, spacious and modern, and clean. Decor is modern and professional. Bathrooms, again, clean, new and fresh. Hotel is much better than the Sheraton & the Hyatt. The hotel is 5 minute walk from the Eaton centre. Would definitely stay again, or try the Hilton Garden Inn in the Entertainment District. Happy I have finally found a good, affordable hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Super Service from staff”
Reviews.Author: bwbman2007
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed while in T.O. to see the Tim Burton exhibit. I had searched on line and found that bundled up with the Tourism Toronto shopping deal, this was an extraordinary bargain for a great hotel name. When I arrived I realized this was the former Comfort Suites where I had stayed before,but now decked out in a classier fashion. I give all services of this hotel top marks except for location which to be fair is only a ten minute walk from Young and Dundas, but you will encounter "panhandlers".Walk with purpose and they will ignore you as in any other big city. The entire staff was great but I must give a particular "shoutout" to the young lady in charge at the breakfast room. She handled every customer in a courteous and genuine friendly manner.She is the type of staff member all other higher pricied hotels I have stayed in seriously need to model themselves after.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfy bed!”
Reviews.Author: canuckcat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night although we did not spend much time in the hotel. The location was great, really easy to get to from the highway and close to the bars. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms were clean. Would come back again; great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a comfortable stay in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Natarwen
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here and loved our experience. The room with a king bed was very nice and we had a lot of space to move around. The bathroom was clean and spacious. The only peeve with had with the room was that it was very hot, even when we turned off the heat. I guess that's because we were on the 5th floor and the heat from the rooms below augmented the heat in our room. As for breakfast, it was not included but for about 12 $, we had access to the hotel's breakfast menu, which was a buffet with everything you could want for breakfast and then some ! The staff at the front desk was very helpful, giving us information about public transportation (fees, maps, etc.) and local attractions. They also have a bagage hold, which is very handy when you arrive around noon and your room isn't ready. Check-in and check-out were both quick and efficient. The hotel is located on the corner of Jarvis and Dundas street. It is only a 5 to 10 minute walk from the Dundas subway station, the Canon Theatre, Dundas Square, the Eaton Centre, etc. For those who like to walk, it is within reasonable walking distance from attractions like the CN Tower and the Allans Garden. I recommend this hotel for those who enjoy exploring Toronto on foot or by public transportation and for those who want a quiet, clean and comfortable stay in a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Hwy363
Reviews.Content: A pleasant surprise! I stayed here really only because it was a bit cheaper than the other Hilton options in downtown Toronto. I'm glad I did. Like others say, the interior is much nicer than the exterior would suggest. The building has been very nicely renovated from whatever it was before. The staff are great - very friendly and always trying to help. Really good breakfast is available with very attentive wait staff. Other reviewers have mentioned the location, but don't be put off. It is right next to Ryerson University and is only six walkable blocks or so from Yonge/Dundas Square and Eaton Centre. If you would rather not walk, the streetcar stops right outside the hotel door and is a very convenient link to the Yonge subway (it also goes straight to the heart of Chinatown). It is true that there are a few strange characters wandering around Dundas/Jarvis (there is a large homeless/detox shelter a half block away), but they are completely harmless and hotel security is excellent. Don't let the sight of them keep you from wandering around a bit. A great value for the downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: g_ordna
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about location on arrival but for us actually was unfounded. Hotel breakfast above average. The hotel has more amenities and help than most Garden inns, including a concierge. Staff here is really good and helpful. It felt like a hotel more upscale than most garden inns.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the exterior fool you; modern and clean rooms inside”
Reviews.Author: silverthief2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights, two paid for and two on points. The front desk figured this out with no trouble and everyone at the desk was courteous and knew answers to questions. Don't let the strange-looking exterior fool you, as it is rather nice inside. All the common spaces are fresh and contemporary, including the business centre on 1st floor and the gym and breakfast area on 2nd floor. Gym was nice and empty every time I went. There is also a pool, but it's not much bigger than the bathtub in your room. Rooms themselves are large, and mine on the 5th floor had a fridge & microwave and a couch. All the furnishings seemed fairly new and contemporary, and it was a large space. Only downside was that the window was really small, almost like a porthole on a cruise ship. There was a bit of noise from the streetcars going by on Dundas, but not too bad. Good location if you want to go over and shop at the Eaton Centre, which I did.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Fernando_Q
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights and was very happy with the room size, was told I could extend my stay for 2 nights at the same rate and if I did not check out they would assume I wanted to stay. On the last day, I double-checked that I could stay the two nights and was told the entire hotel is overbooked, and currently 5 guests are still in need of rooms, so I had to check out ASAP. No matter who I talked to the only available option was to go to another hotel. During the stay, I tried to use the printing services only to find out (an hour later) that the service does not work, so much for "complimentary remote printing" I was also very unhappy with the "high speed internet" felt like dial-up would have been a better option. The concierge is really just there to look like there is a concierge because she is rather not useful at all. Lastly, the neighborhood is rather sketchy, I encountered several homeless and drunks asking for money plus crack-heads are just around the corner. There are better hotels in Downtown than this, save yourself the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodations, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: stryker32
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business, and stayed at this hotel with colleagues. First of all, three of us booked one suite. When I checked in, we were put in a regular room. That mistake was easy to fix. The second problem was a lack of towels and washcloths in the room. One person in our party was allergic to feathers, and she called the front desk inquiring about a hypoallergenic pillow. She had to call three times before getting a pillow. I also called multiple times about getting washcloths. Most of the time, the staff never delivered them to our room. A person in our party brought her own towel/spa wrap. She accidentally left it in the bathroom, and the staff took it. Luckily, she was able to get it back. On the hotel website, a shuttle service is advertised for corporate clients and Hilton Honors members. Our party was booked through a corporate rate, and the staff kept on insisting that we were not allowed to use the shuttle unless we were Hilton Honors members. Lucky for us, the driver was very nice and drove us to our conference anyway. According to the driver, the shuttle service was available to all guests. A member of our party left two nights early. The hotel manager refused to take off the charge for the extra person on our hotel bill because "we were getting such a good rate anyway". If we wanted that charge off of our bill, we would have needed to book the more expensive rate. Another colleague in the conference had a problem with keeping her conference rate when trying to shorten her stay. She accidentally reserved an extra night. On the second to last night, the fire alarm went off at 4 a.m. This hotel is poorly run, and not in the best neighborhood. I would not recommend staying here. The actual rooms were spacious and comfortable. I slept very well when there wasn't a fire alarm.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value....except for valet parking”
Reviews.Author: 1_world--traveller_1
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was perfect except for the valet parking. The room is large, the bed is excellent and the front desk staff and concierge was friendly and helpful. This hotel is very very clean and quiet considering the location. However, the valet parking situation needs improvement. At $30 per night, and mandatory valet parking I would have excepted better service and care to my car. At most hotels the valet parking attendant is always available to help, however at this location you have to hunt them down. The wait is very long to get your car back and they drive the cars like they are race cars, rather than someones personal property. I would definately stay here again....only if I didn't have a car to park.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, huge room”
Reviews.Author: 60PlusAdelaide_SA
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn. The only negative is the location - it is on the edge of the activity and whilst the tram goes into the city centre the surrounding area is not wonderful. But that said, the hotel is great! The rooms are huge and the facilities outstanding. The breakfast has lots of choices and extremely good value! I would recommend this hotel for stopping over in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Garden Inn - would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: BFD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a business trip. Very comfortable, clean hotel, and received an upgraded room on arrival. If you are checking in here, make sure you park your car in the driveway. I parked mine out the front when we first went into reception, and we were quickly warned by reception to move it onto hotel property. I went straight outside to find a parking cop just about to start writing a ticket, thankfully he stopped when I explained we were only just checking into the hotel. Could have been a very expensive welcome from the city of Toronto. Some good bards and restaurants just down the street, with a chemist/drugstore on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: tippitchyfeet
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to Toronto during which i stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn on a part-work, part-leisure break with a colleague. Our stay was fantastic from both perspectives. From a work perspective the location downtown was great, the free internet access and computer and office supplies room was so helpful. From a lesire perspective we loved the pool, location and comfort. The staff are so accommodating and will go out of thier way to help you in any way they can. I had the best sleep I've had in years in their super comfortable beds. The rooms were spotless and spacious. Breakfast was a real treat too - waffles, pancakes, fruit, granola, omlette, bagels, cereal, pastries, etc. Yum! My only minor reservation was the two blocks leading to the hotel - they were slightly intimidating at night. that said we never had any problems and it is only two blocks and they are fine during the day. Cabs are plentiful in any case. I would 100% recommend this hotel for its staff, location, comfort and facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel M
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night at this property, and it was amazing. The hotel lobby was absolutely gorgeous! The front desk staff were very pleasant (especially when checking out), and the valet was very friendly. The rooms were extremely nice! Very modern, and comfy beds. The view was not so great.. as with most Toronto hotels, they have small windows. But I can't complain. There wasn't a ton of stuff to do in the neighbourhood.. but everything is a short and cheap cab ride away. I would most definitely recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in downtown TO”
Reviews.Author: psmith45
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this hotel in it's previous incarnation as a Comfort Suites, and the new refurbished version is great. The room was really nice, a huge space with big bed and very nice bathroom facilities, free internet, nice big screen tv, and friendly helpful staff. Perhaps slightly on the pricey side, especially given this is in a bit of a sketchy part of town, but I come to this area occasionally for business, so I'd have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lock up your stuff or it will mysterously disappear!”
Reviews.Author: studenttraveler88
Reviews.Content: We had mistakenly though that a locked hotel room would be safe and did not put our 3 laptops in the safe (not that all 3 of them would fit anyways) and one of the laptops went missing during our stay. Called down to the front desk when we noticed and they pretty much had no idea what to do, didn't know where the nearest police office was to file a report, nothing. Called the police, who eventually sent 2 officers to the hotel and we filed a report. Unfortunately, there are no cameras in the hallways of the hotel. The hotel got the data from the key card reader for our room. Essentially while we were gone no one came into the room, except for 2 incidences where staff entered (to clean the room and I don't know what else, they couldn't tell us for sure, apparently sometimes a supervisor checks the rooms to make sure they are cleaned properly). One of the members of our party returned slightly earlier than the rest of the group to rest. The hotel takes this to mean that it can't be certain what happened or who took the laptop. Essentially, implying that one member of our group could of taken it, absurd! We were then lectured on using the safe. We'll never make that mistake again! So if you stay here, use the safe or a someone on staff will steal your things and then the hotel will try and blame you for it. we were offered a free night for the next time that we are in toronto, but we will never stay at a hilton again. So they comped us 1 night of our stay instead. Besides the missing laptop, we for some reason never had enough towels and had to ask for more every day. The location isn't the best, I wasn't comfortable walking to the hotel at night. The staff in the dinning area on the 2nd floor were apparently new, but were very nice and attentive, and the breakfast was good. The highlight of the stay was the food at Caseys, was excellent. The best club sandwich I've had from any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in over-priced Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: john45cc
Reviews.Content: Three night stay for Blue Jays opener and Trans- Siberian Orchestra concert. Very convenient for both venues. Five minute walk to subway and theatre. Rooms are very spacious, clean, comfortable and well equipped. Free wired and WiFi high speed internet that works! Noise not a problem for us. Friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: sgs409
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I were in Toronto for our one year anniversary. We had driven up from New York and actually drove past it first time around. If you're driving, the hotel actually fronts onto Jarvis St. When I first walked into the hotel, I thought I was in a boutique hotel, not a major chain. The lobby was chic and modern. After checking in we went up to our room, and as we walked in there was the stench of smoke. Both of us are non-smokers, so we called down to the desk and were immediately assigned a new room, four doors down. The room was very nice; modern, clean, and fresh. The room was also quite large for a hotel room, with a king size bed, tv chest, desk and couch. There was room to move, which is nice, it made it feel more like a guest room than a hotel. The bathroom was not as big, but it was clean and had an awesome shower. We stayed 3 nights, and really enjoyed our stay. There is a streetcar stop right on the corner, you can take it up to Dundas Square, the Eaton Center, and Dundas Subway Word to the wise: The breakfast offered at the hotel is pretty expensive, $12.99 for a buffet, $15.99 for an omlet. You're better off walking up Dundas (toward the Eaton Center), turning left on Yonge, and walking about three or four blocks to Sunset Grill. (A great find through a travel book)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, unfriendly, and unprofessional.”
Reviews.Author: unafLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a potentially lovely hotel, well located and nicely furbished. The staff at the front desk were over-zealous to the point of being creepy, but this may have been a cultural difference, as I'm a conservative European. I stayed for 3 weeks on business, and although the room was clean when I moved in, the standards soon deteriorated. Housekeeping apparently visited the room daily, but within a week I was staying in a room with no toilet paper and dirty bedsheets (although I'd specifically requested them to be replaced). The room had no kettle but had a microwave, coffee maker and refrigerator. The fresh coffee was a nice touch, but frankly quite useless without milk, which was never provided. The microwave and coffee maker were NEVER cleaned, so I had to clean these myself. The refrigerator was old and broken, my juice fell out of the broken door. The ice bucket wasn't cleaned by the housekeepers, and I found melted ice still in it, day after day. Overall - a potentially nice hotel, but they have a serious need for some new housekeepers.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: PastTimesWriter
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, with supportive front desk. The room was large and clean, including the bathroom. There was some street noise but we were in downtown Toronto so to be expected. Hotel is about 10-15 minute walk from the Eaton Centre, so was in a good location. We did not wander around the streets after dark so have no clue of the night activity in the area (we used taxi for door to door service). I will use this hotel again and will recommend it to others. I would say that this is an above basic hotel accommodation. Check the website for packages deals if looking for cultural interests in Toronto as I did this after I had booked, not before.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Hotel, iffy neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Angel0131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton Garden Inn City Centre for only one night, but it was a very pleasent stay. The hotel staff was welcoming and accomdating. The fitness centre and pool area, though small was well equipped. We didnt eat in the Caseys attatched, but it was busy and seemed to be well recieved. The perks that i liked about the hotel was that there was a small sort of pantry that was open 24 hours to guests. This pantry stocked food, like frozen entrees and sandwiches, drinks, snacks as well as travellers necessities. The rooms were clean and very very comfortable. A great stay, just stay to the west side of the hotel....beyond that the neighbourhood changes a little. It is also within walking distance to the Eaton Centre and many other downtown attractions. I would definitly stay there again! Very reasonable and pleasent!

Reviews.Title: “Convert from the Toronto Hilton”
Reviews.Author: TexasTraveler0
Reviews.Content: After having the service deteriorate at the Toronto Hilton, I decided to give the Hilton Garden Inn a try. I was very pleasantly surprised at the service and attention I received at this hotel. Being a Diamond in the Hilton Honors program also brought a free made to order breakfast for every day of the stay. An additional benefit is the rooms have refrigirators and microwaves. With a Metro Grocery within two blocks, I could control what I ate for dinner and avoid eating every meal at a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: LOR028
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL! SAFE YOUR SELF AND YOUR MONEY! I stayed there on a saturday over night. Reservations were made long in advance and when we showed up they had no idea what we were talking about! Finally we got a room- 711 pent house. Calling it a pent house is not even close. Its an alright room but they can not call that a pent house. Once we checked out.. we thought things were okay but little did i know that they then had charged my Visa and extra charge of $375.56 on top of the regular room rate. When i called back to find out why and get this taken care of, I talked to a Jackie. She is NO help and needs to get her [--] together and do her job. She is incharge of transactions. It is now a week later and NO ONE from there, even the manager can help me or tell me why ive been over charged greatly! This hotel has HORRIBLE service!! MY ADVICE: DONT PUT YOUR SELF THROUGH THE HASSEL.. its not even thta nice of a hotel. This is toronto so if you are looking to rent a room, there are many many hotels that have their sh*t together. TRUST ME>> DO NOT STAY THERE!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best choice possible”
Reviews.Author: 11travelguy
Reviews.Content: Typically we do not stay in a city but because we were going to Toronto for a concert, a musical and a hockey game we thought it would be convenient. As a Hilton Honors member I looked to see what could be our best choice but checked out reviews. Some of the early reviews did not sond the best but looked at evrything and decided on the Hilton Garden Inn City Centre. What a great choice for us! It was very convenient to use the public transportation. The streetcar stopped right off the curb at the hotel. From there wee went to our events seemlessly without problems. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Since Hilton took over this property in August 2009 it was expected that everything was refurbished and fresh. When we entered our room we were not disappointed. The beds were very comfortable, the ergo chair at the desk was perfect for my wife who has fibromyalgia andit had a small fridge and microwave. We couldn't have been happier with our choice . Some reviews made note of the neighborhood but if you stay to the west of the hotel you will be fine. The only drawback was the $30/day for parking, but it is expected in major city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service Very Handy for Eaton Centre Shops”
Reviews.Author: L0STAgain
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has just been completely refurbished (Aug 2009) and is very handy for all shops and attractions for Toronto Eaton Centre. The location while being central is just a couple of blocks towards a slightly rougher area of town and because of that some people may be concerned about going out at night. The hotel itself was excellent and the staff could not have been more customer focused and caring. We enjoyed a meal in the adjoining "Casey's" restaurant. The hotels location did not spoil our enjoyment and you will see that i have rated it high in all other areas. Great for that central Shopping area

Reviews.Title: “A good week in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Roamer_67
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Toronto on business a really liked this hotel. The room was a great value (size and quality) and hotel was clean and well kept. The staff were most helpful, the morning breakfast was excellent. The lobby and the rooms were new and had a nice efficient design aesthetic . The only issue was the location - while its a short, safe walk to the Eaton Center, the immediate neighborhood is bit run down - which isnt such in an issue in safe city like Toronto, but I think some travelers might take issue with it. On a related matter, when I mentioned to some clients where I was staying they cringed -apparently the area has a not so nice reputation in Toronto. That aside, I would certainly stay here again - since these issue are not of concern to me and the hotel is a nice clean place and a great value for downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel good but..”
Reviews.Author: SanDiego3
Reviews.Content: there's a strip club right behind it! Kind of creepy. The neighborhood is typical of a large metro area...homeless folks hit you up for money right in front hotel. But I did feel safe walking to and from Yonge and Queen streets as there was lots of pedestrian traffic out at night. Hotel was very nice. Friendly staff, nice modern decor. comfy beds, chair, free internet. Only not so good: $30 CN to park. I am liking the HG Inn chain better than Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “A nice addition to the Hilton Garden Inn family”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: As some other reviewers have pointed out, this location used to be a Comfort Suites hotel. Hilton took over this property earlier this year and has completely redone the place. Fans of the Hilton brand now have several options in DT Toronto. The flagship Hilton Toronto, a Hilton Garden Inn on Peter Street (Entertainment district) and this new offering. I would say that all three will cater to a slightly different audience due to location and pricing. The flagship Hilton Toronto will appeal more to the "traditional" business traveller as it is a traditional full service hotel and of course,is the most expensive. The Hilton Garden Inn on Peter Street is relatively new (March 09) and given its proximity to the entertainment district, the Skydome and the Congress Centre will generally appeal to those having to do "business" in this area. This new offering is a few blocks from the Eaton Centre (shopping) and is probably the least desireable location of the 3 (although there are quite a few other hotels nearby). It also tends to be the least expensive of the 3 (usually $10-$20 less than the other Garden Inn. Although I personally do not find the location to be ideal, the hotel itself is great. The room that I was assigned to was an upgrade featuring separate living and sleeping area, a small one-person spa/jacuzzi and a lot of space. The room was very clean and given that it was entirely renovated, it was in very good shape. In terms of views, not much to see. The hotel has the standard "Hilton Gym by Precor" featuring equipment with individual LCD TVs. The model of elliptical machine used at this location is one model down (resistance only, not able to change crossramp) vs what appears to be standard in most other Hiltons. Free wireless internet. Good breakfast buffet available Excellent service from staff For the price, this is a great offering and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN THE WORLD!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: davakeish
Reviews.Content: I spent one week at this hotel and I must say that I was so impress with everything, the room was so clean and comfortable, the service was exceptional. I stayed in room 503 and my friends and family called me every minute of the day and I thought that they would have been annoyed to be transfering the calls so often to the same room but fortunately they were not. I love this place and would go back now. Very beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Downtown TO”
Reviews.Author: Strathroy6ontheGO
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Hilton Garden Inn on Jarvis street to do some back to school shopping with the kids. The two level suites were outstanding!! Had stayed once before a couple of years back in a regular room, but never in one of these suites. The place just completed a top to bottom renovation.......very modern. Really enjoyed the new bar and restauarant....breakfast was great. Highly recommend this place over any of the higher priced hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “New Hilton: Beautiful with Some Minor Flaws”
Reviews.Author: kickerAuburnNy
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Hilton Garden Inn Dundas Street location (it was a Comfort Inn until Aug 1, 2009). Everything in the Hotel is new, therefore the rooms were exceptionally clean and comfortable: Adjustable beds for firmness/softness, comfortable desk chair, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, free Wii-Fii, whirlpool tub in bath (with colored lights!). No complaints at all about the room with the exception of a lack of soundproofing - we could hear loud conversations from the adjoining room - it didn't bother us, but might bother light sleepers. Facilities: Exercise room had weights, elliptical, 2 treadmills. Decent sized indoor pool and hot tub on 2nd floor. Restaurant (we were there one night, didn't use it). Continental Buffet was $13; Full Breakfast Buffet $16. We spoke to some in our group who tried it and they were very satisfied. There is a restaurant (Casey's) on the side of the building; Room Service is also available. The Area: this review is written by a 56 yr old guy with a yellow streak down his back. Other reviews talk about the area; I can only assume people writing must live in the country - this area was certainly no worse (and probably better) than you'd find in any large city's downtown area. There was one panhandler in front of the hotel when I went out in the morning; saw one homeless individual sleeping on the sidewalk 2 blocks down. There's a nice Grocery store 2 blocks down on Jarvis; Eaton Centre isn't a far walk (we had a nice dinner at Baton Rouge), and I felt perfectly safe walking the area (others in the group shared the same opinion and said the obvious: just protect your belongings like you would in any city). Negative note: I'd rate this hotel a step up from Fairfield Inns and Hampton Inns (my usual choices). I can't comment on price as it was part of a bus tour group, booked for us. Again, the room amenities were well above average; room service is available. We were lacking an ice bucket - it took 1 1/4 hours to have one brought to our room, so that aspect might need some work. Also, there's a brochure in the rooms about an exercise pad/equipment you can ask to use: I asked at the Front Desk and the clerk had no idea what I was talking about. In closing, I wouldn't let the location of this hotel bother me - Toronto is certainly a major city and its Metro, buses and taxis make it easy to navigate. I would definitely use this facility again if I was in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service needs to improve”
Reviews.Author: Zelenec
Reviews.Content: Booked still with Choice Hotels, I received an e-mail from Choice hotels to check, that my reservation is still accepted while changed to Hilton, which I did about two weeks in advance. Funny enough, when arriving to the hotel, nobody knew about my booking and my rate!! Finally, after 30 minutes I managed to negotiate good deal and got my room. Room was OK, spacious for single traveller, nice bathroom. Housekeeping fine, just found tones of dust in the AC inside the bathroom - seems they clean the floor but never look to the ceiling. Breakfast service fine, good qualiy food, good service - I went always around 7:00 am and probably was one of first customers. Liked the freshly cooked breakfast, good variety of products and very tasteful. If I will be coming back to Toronto and get a good deal, no hesitation to stay in this hotel as the location is perfect. If the rate will not meet my expectation, no hard feeling to get another hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites City Centre now known as Hilton Garden Inn City Centre”
Reviews.Author: firiesclose
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my husband on Aug 18th & 19th. The room was good, had everything we wanted, spacious, LCD TV, iron, fridge etc. However this is the only good thing I can say about this hotel. Breakfast was included but it was chaos both mornings. It as self service except for hot breakfast. Both mornings we had breakfast we discovered that the nothing is restocked as it runs out i.e plates, glasses, juices, hot water, coffee, butter, yogurts etc. There is only 1 hot breakfast cook who keeps his back to the awaiting guests that want to place their order for hot food. The area is dreadful. We arrived the first night at 1am, on approaching the hotel we saw homeless people and prostitutes. While I as checking in & asking how safe was the area there was a drunk woman banging on the window of the car asking my husband to drive her somewhere. There was some hotel guests smoking outside the hotel entrance and they too were being hassled by homeless people. The second night we arrived again by car about 9.30pm and were again hassled by homeless people. We could hardly get out of the car when they were over to us. I could not imagine walking in this area at night time and would not stay here again if it was for free!!

Reviews.Title: “Be Good To Yourself Stay Somewhere Else Please.”
Reviews.Author: peppercorn9
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 23 of August 09, had to make three trips to desk in an attempt to get a key that worked in the door. They then decided that the lock needed to be reprogramed. They gave us another room which was ok. Went for breakfast the next morning but left after waiting 10 minutes for the cook to come out from the back. He never did come out. The restaurant manager was useless in attempting to get him to work. It costs 30 dollars a day for valet parking. You can't walk in the area of the hotel because of the bums trying to get money from you. Not a safe area day or night. They have a business center but the printers don't work There is a Caseys attached to the hotel but is overpriced and the food is of poor quality. This is not a new hotel it just changed ownership. There is no excuse for the poor service or rooms being in disrepair.

Reviews.Title: “New Garden Inn - Still ironing out the wrinkles”
Reviews.Author: pnear
Reviews.Content: This is a nice looking hotel, but there are still lots of issues primarily service related that they need to address. When my family arrived, there was no valet in sight and no obvious self park options. We checked in, left the keys with the front desk, and went to our room. While unpacking, my daughter noticed that the carpet was soaking wet. I called down for another room, which they happily accomodated. Attempt #2 was near someone who was smoking, which is not allowed but I figured it's not a hassle I want to deal with when they get the urge again at 2am. Attempt #3 was a decent room, albeit a bit small and with a tiny window that makes the room feel a bit claustrophobic. After putting the kids to bed, my wife and I thought we might rent a movie but alas the hotel has no in-room movies. In the morning, we went to breakfast which was just a disaster. I noticed that the front desk had forgotten to give me our breakfast vouchers, and they quickly gave them to me. The bigger issue was finding somewhere to sit - while there were plenty of open tables the staff hadn't kept up with clearing the tables so they were all littered with dirty dishes. Once we did sit down, the poor service continued. At the breakfast buffet they had run out of plates and when my wife asked the kitchen staff for some plates they were scolded by the dining room staff for giving out the wrong size of plate. Several of the breakfast items were depleted and not being restocked. When people did hunt down the breakfast manager he was on his cel phone with someone and the customer I'm sure felt like they were interrupting him. In general it was chaos, and we think it's because the team of 3 people didn't have clear roles - one should be bussing tables, one should be keeping the buffet stocked, and one dealing with bills. On the hot food, my wife ordered pancakes from the kitchen and stood around for about 20 minutes waiting for them. We had all finished (including custom omelettes) by the time the pancakes arrived. When we were done, I couldn't find a waitress so just left my coupon on the table (without tip) and went back to our room. The hotel is not in the greatest area of Toronto, but it's a quick walk or streetcar ride to Yonge street. Overall, it's a very nicely renovated hotel in a decent area, with some major issues to figure out related to customer service.
